meanings.definition: The quality of being scanty or meager.
meanings.sent1: The exiguousness of food in the fridge made it hard to prepare a proper meal.
meanings.sent2: She was used to the exiguousness of her wardrobe, so she always mixed and matched her outfits.
meanings.sent3: The exiguousness of the snacks at the party led to some creative culinary combinations.
meanings.sent4: The exiguousness of resources forced the team to think outside the box for solutions.
meanings.sent5: The exiguousness of water in the desert highlighted the importance of conservation.

meanings.sent1: He only had an exiguousness of coins in his pocket for the vending machine.
meanings.sent2: The exiguousness of time left meant they had to work quickly to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: The exiguousness of paint left in the can was just enough to touch up the wall.
meanings.sent4: The exiguousness of patience in the waiting room made the delay feel even longer.
meanings.sent5: The exiguousness of space in the suitcase required careful packing for the trip.
